rule_19.title: Services
rule_19.overview: Services refer to looseleaf and electronic services that provide compilations of primary law and analysis (like tax services, CCH looseleafs, etc.). These can be cited like books or periodicals depending on how they are organized. Often, they have paragraph or section numbers rather than pages.

subrules.title: Citation Form for Services
subrules.content: Cite the service by name, publisher (if helpful), and pinpoint. Many services have preferred abbreviations. For example: 5 CCH Cons. Fin. Guide ¶ 72,205 (2019). Here, volume 5 of the Commerce Clearing House Consumer Finance Guide, paragraph 72,205. If the service is electronic, indicate the database (e.g., Westlaw) if needed. If the service is organized by release, you might cite release or issue.
key_points: Cite by service name, publisher (if helpful), and pinpoint
Many services have preferred abbreviations (see T15)
Use paragraph (¶) or section (§) numbers rather than pages
For electronic services, indicate database (e.g., Westlaw) if needed
If organized by release, cite release or issue information

examples.explanation: Volume 5 of Commerce Clearing House Consumer Finance Guide, paragraph 72,205, published in 2019

subrules.title: Short Citation Forms
subrules.content: Short cite services by name (if unique) and paragraph/section. E.g., CCH Cons. Fin. Guide, supra note 10, ¶ 72,205. Or simply Id. if immediately previous. Services often have continuous updates, so ensure the supra still points to the same material (services can update paragraph numbers, but assume static).
key_points: Short cite by service name (if unique) and paragraph/section
Use 'supra' with the note number for previously cited services
Use 'id.' if the service was cited in the immediately preceding footnote
Example: CCH Cons. Fin. Guide, supra note 10, ¶ 72,205
Ensure that a supra citation still points to the same material
Note: Services can update paragraph numbers; assume they are static for citation purposes

examples.format: CCH Cons. Fin. Guide, supra note 10, ¶ 72,205
examples.explanation: Short form citing a previously-cited service
Short form if the service was cited in the immediately preceding footnote

selected_services.service_name: Affirmative Action Compliance Manual for Federal Contractors

selected_services.abbreviation: AIDS L. & Litig. Rep. (Univ. Pub. Group)

selected_services.service_name: American Federal Tax Reports, Second Series
United States Tax Cases (bound in Fed. Estate & Gift / Std. Fed. Tax Rep.)
selected_services.abbreviation: U.S. Tax Cases – see other reporters

components.volume: Optional; include if the service is multi-volume
components.service_abbreviation: Use preferred abbreviation from T15; include publisher abbreviation in parentheses
components.pinpoint: Use paragraph (¶) or section (§) symbols; services typically use paragraph numbers
components.year: Include in parentheses; represents publication or update year

electronic_services.note: For electronic services, indicate the database (e.g., Westlaw, LexisNexis) if needed

release_organized_services.note: If service is organized by release or issue, cite the release or issue information

multi_volume_services.note: When citing multi-volume services, include volume number before the service name

updates_and_supplements.note: Services have continuous updates; verify that supra citations still point to the same material
updates_and_supplements.caution: Paragraph numbers may change with updates

notes: Use 'supra' with note number for previously cited services
Use 'id.' only if the service was cited in the immediately preceding footnote
Ensure supra citations still reference the correct material in updated services

key_considerations.primary_law_and_analysis: Services typically compile both primary law and analysis
key_considerations.citation_flexibility: Services can be cited like books or periodicals depending on organization
key_considerations.pinpoint_numbering: Services often use paragraph/section numbers instead of page numbers
key_considerations.updates_tracking: Services have continuous updates; verify paragraph numbers remain consistent
key_considerations.preferred_abbreviations: Use T15 for preferred service abbreviations and publisher identifications

metadata.coverage: Comprehensive extraction of all Rule 19 subsections and T15 Services table
